children.name: Basic Placeholders
children.content:
The name of this sniplet (Basic Placeholders):
$[NAME]

The folder this sniplet is in (Placeholders):
$[FOLDER]

The full path to this sniplet (Sniplets/Placeholders):
$[PATH]

Same as above with a custom delimiter (Sniplets > Placeholders):
$[PATH( > )]

The name and version of your browser:
$[HOSTAPP]

The User Agent your browser identifies as:
$[UA]

children.name: Custom Placeholders
children.content: Values for custom placeholders will be confirmed when pasting or using the clipboard feature: $[Custom Placeholder] A default value can be added in curly braces: $[Default{Text}] If your placeholder should be chosen from a list, you can separate the values with a pipe (|) symbol where the first option will be default: $[Select Value{Option 1|Option 2|Option 3}] If you want a special type of input field, you can specify its name in brackets: $[Date & Time(datetime-local)] It‚Äôs possible to combine types and default values as long as the values are valid for the input type: $[Date Picker(date){2024-05-04}] $[Time Picker(time){16:30}] The above can be especially useful for rich text fields like so: Highlighted Text

children.name: Date
children.content:
The default date display for the locale:
$[DATE]

The current date and time with custom formatting:
$[DATE(ddd, MMM DD, YYYY hh:mm:ss A ZZ)]

Locale-based date strings of decreasing length:
$[DATE(full)]
$[DATE(long)]
$[DATE(medium)]
$[DATE(short)]

children.name: Time
children.content:
The default time display:
$[TIME]

The current time with custom formatting:
$[TIME(h:mm A Z)]

Locale-based time strings of decreasing length:
$[TIME(full)]
$[TIME(long)]
$[TIME(medium)]
$[TIME(short)]

children.name: Counters
children.content:
Counters will use the default starting value chosen in the settings menu, and will then increase by one each time it‚Äôs encountered. 

A default auto-incrementing counter (next value +1):
#[COUNTER], #[COUNTER]

Adding a number in brackets after the counter name will change the increment.

This will increase COUNTER by 2 after replacement:
#[COUNTER(2)], #[COUNTER(2)]

This will decrease COUNTER by 2 after replacement:
#[COUNTER(-2)], #[COUNTER(-2)]

This will preserve the value of COUNTER after replacement:
#[COUNTER(0)], #[COUNTER(0)]

children.name: RichText
children.content:
This is a rich text sample

By default, regular new lines like these two: will be marked with rich text line break (
) tags so they won‚Äôt turn into spaces. URLs without anchor tags like https://github.com/AppliedElegance/Sniplets/issues will be hotlinked automatically along with email addresses like noreply@example.com. These behaviours can be changed in the settings menu. The copy button at the top right of this sniplet will add both plain and rich text versions of this processed sniplet ($[PATH]/$[NAME]) to the clipboard, just like if you‚Äôd copied it from a webpage.

children.name: [NOSUBST] Disabled
children.content:
The following text will be pasted as-is and without any rich text processing due to the inclusion of [NOSUBST] at the beginning of the sniplet name:
$[NAME], $[FOLDER], $[PATH]
$[HOSTAPP], $[UA]
#[COUNTER]
$[DATE], $[TIME]
unlinked.com, email@unlinked.com

children.name: Enhancements
children.content:
The following enhanced placeholders are incompatible with Clippings and should be avoided if regularly sharing backups:

$[PATH] & $[PATH(>)]
PATH placeholders ($[PATH]) will be treated as blank custom fields, while PATH placeholders with custom delimiters (like $[PATH(>)]) will be ignored completely.

$[DATE(short)], $[TIME(long)], etc.
Clippings does not understand the ‚Äúfull‚Äù, ‚Äúlong‚Äù, ‚Äúmedium‚Äù and ‚Äúshort‚Äù date & time formats and so will ignore these fields completely.

#[COUNTER(0)]
Clippings has no facility for controlling counters and will ignore fields with custom incrementation completely.

children.name: Welcome to Sniplets!
children.content:
On the top line you will find a settings menu, the current folder path, a sync icon that allows you to swap between synchronizing your sniplets or keeping them local, buttons for adding new folders and sniplets in the current folder and a pop-out button to make organizing your sniplets easier (unless you‚Äôre already in a separate window).

Clicking on a folder name will open it. Try clicking the Placeholders folder to see how the path updates.

children.name: ü¢Ä Try clicking the icon!
children.content:
Folder and sniplet icons can be clicked to open their menu. The options currently available allow you to change the icon colour and move the item up or down manually. To move sniplets around, you can also drag their border and drop them into a folder or position, and for folders just drag their button.

On the right are buttons to rename (folders), copy to clipboard (sniplets) or delete. Once you get the hang of it, feel free to delete the tutorials! You can delete everything and start fresh right away by going to the settings menu at the top left under ‚ÄúData‚Äù and clicking ‚ÄúClear All Data and settings‚Äù.
